result.execSummary:
The defendant Candido Pena was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs (Heroin) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: BOTH CTS: Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge if not already done. Pay all costs and surcharges within 1 year of release from custody, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

BOTH CTS:  FIRST FOUR (4) MONTHS Huber privileges for work and treatment.  LAST SIX (6) MONTHS: Huber privileges for work and treatment AND Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.
 

Consecutive to: to any sentence, credit for 4 days time served.
BOTH CTS: Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.
Concurrent with: with CT 1, credit for 4 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Candido Pena

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Candido Pena
Current: 1833A S 17TH ST, Milwaukee, WI 53204   (Effective: 03-27-2014)
Prior: 1814 South 31st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215

Defendant Candido Pena in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

COUNT 1:    Court sentenced defendant to serve 10 months in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 4 days served; FIRST FOUR (4) MONTHS Huber privileges for work and treatment.  LAST SIX (6) MONTHS: Huber privileges for work and treatment AND Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.
 
- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order signed and filed.  
- Pay all costs and surcharges within 1 year of release from custody, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.  

COUNT 2:        Court sentenced defendant to serve 10 months in the House of Correction CONCURRENT WITH COUNT 1 with credit for 4 days served; FIRST FOUR (4) MONTHS Huber privileges for work and treatment.  LAST SIX (6) MONTHS: Huber privileges for work and treatment AND Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.
 
- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order signed and filed.  
- Pay all costs and surcharges within 1 year of release from custody, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Candido Pena in court with attorney Christopher L Hartley.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BRANCH 10 FOR BRANCH 26
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned to allow the state to comply with victim notification.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-18-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Candido Pena in court with attorney Christopher L Hartley.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hauer).
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea hearing scheduled for 06-04-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Candido Pena in court with attorney Christopher L Hartley.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea hearing scheduled for 05-27-2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 04-24-2014 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 26.

Defendant Candido Pena in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. 
Clerk:  jms

The Court ordered no use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Candido Pena in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. cmt
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned for pretrial in Branch 44.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/28/14 @ 1:30pm
